intent: Identify the month with the highest gas consumption for SME customers in 2013.

candidates.sql: SELECT MONTH(gas_consumption.date) AS peak_month, SUM(gas_consumption.amount) AS total_consumption FROM gas_consumption JOIN customers ON gas_consumption.customer_id = customers.id WHERE customers.type = 'SME' AND YEAR(gas_consumption.date) = 2013 GROUP BY MONTH(gas_consumption.date) ORDER BY total_consumption DESC LIMIT 1;

column_relationships.note: Joining gas consumption records with customer details.

candidates.sql: SELECT MONTH(gas_consumption.date) AS peak_month FROM gas_consumption WHERE customer_id IN (SELECT id FROM customers WHERE type = 'SME') AND YEAR(gas_consumption.date) = 2013 GROUP BY MONTH(gas_consumption.date) ORDER BY SUM(amount) DESC LIMIT 1;

column_relationships.note: Filtering gas consumption by SME customers using a subquery.

notes: Assumes 'gas_consumption' table has 'customer_id' and 'amount' columns, and 'customers' table has 'id' and 'type' columns. Year extraction is based on standard SQL functions.
